diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with severe epigastric pain, elevated total bilirubin, mild leukocytosis, and CT findings consistent with cholelithiasis and pericholecystic fluid, indicating inflammation of the gallbladder. The history of GERD and abdominal pain, along with imaging results showing gallstones and thickening of the gallbladder wall, supported the diagnosis of cholecystitis.
